results.title: Suddenly you're a parent
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
Looks at the birth of a baby, examines the new born’s reflex abilities, and discusses the importance of movement and touch. The premature birth is also discussed.

results.title: The First few months
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
Parents are likely to encounter some problems during the first few months after the birth of their child. These problems include meeting the needs of demanding babies, coping with an unsettled baby, maintaining support when tired and irritable, and simply finding some peace and quiet. Relaxation techniques are discussed, ways to handle babies are demonstrated and preparations for “baby’s” first venture “outside” by car, travel, etc are also discussed.

results.title: My Body
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
This title covers the following topics: Circumcision - we provide information about why and how this operation is performed on male babies, and discuss the care of the uncircumcised penis. Teeth - the symptoms and some solutions to teething problems are discussed and PGR looks at how to keep teeth healthy. Feet and Legs - children often appear to have bandy legs, knock knees or pigeon toes in early years of walking. An orthopaedic surgeon discusses these in the context of the development of a “normal” walking pattern. Body Awareness - PGR discusses children’s body awareness illustrating the way in which children discover and play with their bodies. Questions - groups of parents talk about how best to answer those awkward or embarrassing questions children ask about their bodies.

results.title: Parties
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
Children’s birthdays can be a pleasure or a disaster. PGR speaks with two mothers, seasoned party givers, on how to plan a successful party. The questions of where to hold a successful party. The questions of where to hold the party - indoors/outdoors, guests, duration, safety, food, and possible plans for entertainment to offer the children, are discussed. Encouraging the children to paint a table cloth and how to make party hats and invitations introduces some novel ideas. An excellent tape for parents wanting to ensure their children’s birthday parties are happy and successful events.

results.title: Fathers
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
In Australian society most men become fathers, but how do they know what to do? In this title, men talk about fatherhood and what it means to them, and PGR looks at the father’s role beyond that of the traditional “provider”.

results.title: Country Kids
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
Colin talks to mothers about their reactions to living in small isolated communities such as those serviced by the Australian national train “The Tea and Sugar”. Paula talks to a representative of RICE and local women about the benefits of the Community Service van, which travels with the train. PGR also looks at life on an isolated sheep station, and we listen to the stories of some of the women to arrive in

results.title: Buying Toys
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
Examines types of toys appropriate for different age groups, storage hints, the issue of sexism and how to resist pressures from TV, advertising and cartoons.

results.title: Discipline 2
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
PGR Looks at why we discipline our children and the ways we do it, suggesting guidelines for starting the process with young children. Using dramatisations we look at the problem of aggressive behaviour and how to solve it without parents resorting to aggressive behaviour themselves.
